content.prompt: If g is a differentiable function such that g(x)<0 for all real numbers x and if f'(x)=(x2-4)g(x) , which of the following is true?

choices.label: f has a relative maximum at x=-2 and a relative minimum at x=2.
f has a relative minimum at x=-2 and a relative maximum at x=2.
f has relative minima at x=-2 and at x=2.
f has relative maxima at x=-2 and at x=2.
It cannot be determined if f has any relative extrema.

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
